title: Thesaurus musicae sacrae – śpiew gregoriański we współczesnej liturgii – między teorią a praktyką

abstracts.content: Tekst jest próbą odpowiedzi na pytanie o korzenie tożsamości kulturalnej chrześcijańskiej Europy Zachodniej, widziane przez pryzmat śpiewu gregoriańskiego i monodii liturgicznej. Autor stawia liczne pytania dotyczące historycznego i obecnego kształtu oraz miejsca śpiewu w liturgii, a następnie odpowiada na nie w odniesieniu do współczesnej praktyki. Źródłem authenticum fontium gregorianorum, z którego powinno się czerpać utwory gregoriańskie, oprócz Graduale Romanum, są dwie publikacje: Graduale Simplex i Iubilate Deo. Zawierają one zestaw śpiewów w języku łacińskim niezbędny do wypełnienia postulatów większości dokumentów liturgiczno-muzycznych. Liturgia wróci do swojej autentycznej formy – według opata Prospera Guerangera – jeśli wszystkie jej elementy, w tym śpiew, zajmą należyte im miejsce.

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet Muzyczny Fryderyka Chopina w Warszawie

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Karola Lipińskiego we Wrocławiu

title: Tutoring as a form of work and preventive activity by music school teachers

abstracts.content: The article aims to present the use of tutoring in individualised work with music education students and show the benefits of this work style. Initially, the tutoring method and its philosophical and methodological assumptions were introduced. Then, the specificity of music education was discussed, along with the possibilities of using tutoring in working with students and their parents. Finally, the preventive function of this method and its use to build students’ mental resilience in accordance with the concept of resilience were discussed. The methodical aspect of tutoring combined with the teacher’s competencies creates an opportunity to create a unique master-student relationship, typical of music education.

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet Muzyczny Fryderyka Chopina w Warszawie

title: Elementy improwizacji w praktyce akompaniamentu liturgicznego

otherTitles.title: The elements of improvisation in liturgical accompaniment practice

abstracts.content: The area of study in this article covers the elements of improvisation in the practice of liturgical accompaniment. Music, an important sphere in the liturgy besides fixed forms ascribed to specific services, also lends itself to improvised forms: preludes, postludes, interludes as well as various kinds of meditations, drawing on the centuries-old treasury of Christian musical tradition. By introducing elements of improvisation, each song, in its multi-verse nature, may be a certain variation cycle. The multiplicity of stylistic inspirations and the variety of improvised forms should serve to preserve the historical identity and help to make each liturgy a musical unity.

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet Muzyczny Fryderyka Chopina w Warszawie

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: Znajomość i kształtowanie potrzeb psychicznych dziecka w edukacji muzycznej

otherTitles.title: Knowing and Shaping the Child’s Psychological Needs as an Essential Context for Music Education

abstracts.content: Needs are an important source for human activity. In upbringing, the distinction between universal and individual needs is important. Individual needs are learned and can be beneficial or detrimental to development. Cultural needs belong to learned needs. They have to be created by the social environment and supported accordingly. In the context of all upbringing, as well as music education, it is necessary to know the universal needs of the child and to act in accordance with them in relation to the specific developmental stage. It is also necessary to create valuable cultural needs, including those in the field of music, as those not created in childhood may not exist in later life.

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet Muzyczny Fryderyka Chopina w Warszawie

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: Metody tworzenia skal muzycznych w improwizacji na podstawie skali durowej i molowej

otherTitles.title: Methods of Building Musical Scales in Improvisation on the Basis of the Major and Minor Scale

abstracts.content: In this article entitled ‘Methods of Building Musical Scales in Improvisation on the Basis of the Major and Minor Scale’ I have highlighted the problem of multiplicity of the different scales and their transpositions which an improviser is obliged to master. Having assumed that an educated musician is able to use all the transpositions of the major and minor scale, I have proposed several solutions for creating modal and certain non-modal scales. Therefore I have identified the way to build the modal scales starting with consecutive degrees of the major (or minor) scale and presented both the advantages and disadvantages of that method. As an alternative, or a supplement, I have devised a method based on the analysis of the role of particular degrees of the music scale that may be treated as a characteristic feature of that scale. Next, I have suggested a solution consisting of adding these features to the selected major or minor scale, resulting in a desired transposition of the modal, or any other, scale. In the text I have raised the issue of creating the harmonic context for particular scales.

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet Muzyczny Fryderyka Chopina w Warszawie

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: The Beggar’s Opera Johna Gaya – między sztuką wyższą a kulturą popularną

otherTitles.title: The Beggar’s Opera by John Gay: Between High Art and Popular Culture

abstracts.content: This article is an attempt to present the history of the creation of John Gay’s work The Beggar’s Opera and the extremely important role that it has played in shaping the popular English-language music theatre. This piece is sometimes even considered a distant ancestor of the modern musical. The text outlines the historical, economic and cultural background of the creation of the work (relating, among others, to significant milestones in the development of opera, especially in the British Isles) and analyses its characteristic features, which made not only the original production of 1728 extremely popular, but also created an interest in this timeless classic in general, especially in the Anglo-Saxon cultural milieu. The article discusses the issues relating to the parody of the then-opera theatre and a critique of the social and political situation in Great Britain at the beginning of the 18th century in The Beggar’s Opera. Gay’s piece is shown as appealing to the popular tastes of London theatre audiences, but at the same time as an innovative work that introduces previously unknown elements to the stage of musical theatre, using on a large scale the techniques that later became characteristic of burlesque (travesty, pastiche) and in fact starting a new genre, ballad opera.

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet Muzyczny Fryderyka Chopina w Warszawie

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: Pedagog jako osoba znacząca w nauce i karierze zawodowej śpiewaka

otherTitles.title: The teacher as an important person in a singers education and career

abstracts.content: Vocal pedagogy is an extremely important issue in the training of the future singer. The role of the teacher at the master-student level is huge and valuable. This article contains profound reflections and thoughts of an accomplished Polish tenor, an artist appreciated for decades and an outstanding teacher. His vocal class has produced many accomplished singers, with Artur Ruciński (baritone) and Rafał Siwek at the forefront, who are now among the world’s greatest singers. In his article, the author discusses work on the students’ voices at both secondary and tertiary music education levels. He differentiates the specifics of working at both levels, offering many interesting reflections. The article is a collection of the teacher’s fascinating insights on teaching vocal awareness, sensitivity to musical phrasing as a key to understanding music, style, encouraging independent scholarly enquiry, a system of encouragement and praise, resilience to stress and breakdowns, providing help at the start of the artistic career path and teaching the beauty that may be found in music.

affiliations.name: Uniwersytet Muzyczny Fryderyka Chopina w Warszawie

book.title: Wokół emisji głosu: technika | metodyka | praktyka, tom 2

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: Z zagadnień życia emocjonalno-uczuciowego dziecka w perspektywie rozwoju

otherTitles.title: On the Issues of Emotional and Affectional Life of the Child from a Developmental Perspective

abstracts.content: The emotional life of a  child is very active. Interactions with adults and peers arouse both positive and negative feelings and they constitute a major educational issue. Psychologists emphasize that emotional development progresses through social experience. Of utmost importance is the way a child is brought up, which can either accelerate or delay this development. The child has to acquire the abilities to regulate and control emotions. Emotional intelligence has been described in specialist literature as important psychological competence both in adults and children. It consists of learning one’s own emotions, emotional self-control, recognizing the emotions of other people, self-motivation skills, establishing and maintaining relations with others. Positive psychologists differentiated between emotional intelligence and emotional creativity. A  particularly important issue is the development of complex emotions in the child which are developed exclusively under the influence of people who experience such emotions. Music can constitute a very crucial factor in the development of emotions and feelings, and musical education should be present in every kindergarten and school both as esthetic and general development classes.
